item.description:
Genome Sequencing and Analysis - Towards Personalized Medicine (by BiotechLikemind) Wednesday, May 16, 2012 from 7:00 PM to 11:00 PM (ET) Boston, United States

 

281 Summer street
Boston, 02210

http://biotechlikemind.eventbrite.com/?ref=enivte&invite=MjAwMjA4Ny9sYW5nLmpvc2hAeWFob28uY29tLzE%3D&utm_source=eb_email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=invitenew&utm_term=eventpage

Wednesday, May 16, 2012 from 7:00 PM to 11:00 PM (ET)  

This event of the BiotechLikemind series will highlight a new entrepreneurial trend in the biotech field - that fuses genome sequencing and analysis to pave the way for personalized medicine. Greater Boston Area has recently flourished with a number of biotech startups that innovate technologies shaping the future of personalized health care. At this event, BiotechLikemind is hosting featured Boston startups that specialize in genome sequencing, analysis and personalized health care. We are excited to hear the stories behind their innovations and their visions for the future.

The event aims to foster new friendships and inspire entrepreneurial thinking. Join the event if you are for innovation, science or networking.

 

Format of the Event:

- Welcome

 

- Nathaniel Pearson, Knome -

"Human Genome Interpretation for... Humans" (10 min)

 

- John Sheffield, Seven Bridges Genomics -

"Rapid innovation in genomics: scaling talent as well as infrastructure" (10 min)

 

- John Rachlin, Diatom Software -

"Cloud PCR for Next Generation Sequencing" (10 min)

 

- Boston Re-development Authority -

A video preview of the upcoming BIO 2012 International Convention in Boston on June 18-21 (5 min)

 

- Mixer for inspiration and networking

 

*** Appetizers and refreshments will be served.


This event is sponsorded by KCSA Strategic Communications
item.name: Genome Sequencing and Analysis - Towards Personalized Medicine
